# automaticallyAdjustsZRange

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that determines whether the camera automatically adjusts its [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/zNear] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/zFar] depth limits.

## Declaration

```swift
var automaticallyAdjustsZRange: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], specifying that the camera’s [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/zNear] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/zFar] properties control its depth limits. If you change this property’s value to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], SceneKit automatically adjusts the depth limits at render time to fit the bounding box of the scene. Changing the values of the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/zNear] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNCamera/zFar] properties automatically resets this property’s value to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Adjusting Camera Perspective

- **zNear**: The camera’s near depth limit. Animatable.
- **zFar**: The camera’s far depth limit. Animatable.
